title: fancy script ampersand
content:
Help me identify where this ampersand is from. Thank you

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen shot 2013-02-05 at 3.14.36 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133944/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202013-02-05%20at%203.14.36%20PM.png) | 51.24 KB |
author: vector

comments.content:
context? (website, document, anything?)  
sometimes it helps.

and to answer your question, this one's darned close:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-edwardian-script/edwardian-scr...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133944/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-edwardian-script/edwardian-scr-alt-itc/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-edwardian-script/edwardian-scr-alt-itc/")
edwardian alt looks like the winner to me
the stroke weights seem off and might need some squeezing/stretching. but it's a start. (or ok as is if you like it!)
